reviews.review_msg: Yonas really helped me understand the course material, I also found him very understanding. Make sure to do the lab exercises as it is good practice for the exams. The final and midterm exam was hard though, so make sure to study hard for those. Plus, he's a cutie.

Yonas probably has one of the worst course outlines in FIC. For example, you can do well during the entire course and a single midterm or final exam can destroy you. For sure it will, because the tasks he provides during the exams are extremely difficult. Should mention that Yonas is a tough grader, and he can deduct up to 75% from the correct answ

The course is very disorganized. I've spent ~90 hours (I've been tracking) working on this course and yet only got a C+. The next semester I took the same class with professor Jiang Ye and got an A. He does not inspire you to work harder and mocks you when you have questions. Also he gives looooots of work and expects you to complete all of them.

He is the worst professor I encountered at FIC. Incredibly disorganized and expects us to spend all our time studying this course. I got better marks in higher-level courses at SFU without having to spend as much time and frustration on them. Additionally, he is very discouraging and purposefully fails his students by adding weight to wrong answers

He definitely fakes the 4/5 rating. More than 60% of students fail the course on the first try and have to re-attempt it to transfer. He is incredibly discouraging and mocks students when they ask for help. His quizzes and exams are graded to ensure your failure, so you need to repeat this course and spend $s. Each week is cruel and soul-wrecking.

One of the best professors in FIC. Dr. Weldeselassie is really caring when you have problems with lab works or quiz and he makes sure that your problem is solved during the office hours. The lecture notes and videos were awesome.

WORST PROFF EVER, he doesn't understand that his course isn't the only thing that matters. His lectures videos are sometimes over 5 hours long per week. Nobody has time for that + a weekly quiz + random assignments that he gives us a week to do but involve hours of work that an engineering student doesn't have! His expectations are too unrealistic.
His lecture was very clear, but his quiz was a disaster. In particular, the quiz score can only be passed or not, either you get a full score, or you can only get 10% or 20%.
Yonas is a good instructor but he is a very tough grader.

His lectures are sub par, he'll do the bare minimum but nothing more. His grading is unreasonably hard and he's mostly non cooperative. His email replies are quick. Try to avoid taking his class. I loved computing BEFORE I took his class...
Best Professor for computing science. Very inspirational. Marks well for the amount of work you show. Office hours and labworks are a must to ace this course.

Best professor for someone who is new to coding. Clears all the basics before starting the course. Explains all the topics rally well. His grading can never go wrong. Do Lab-works regularly to ace this course. Attend his office hours for regular updates and to clear your doubts. Video lectures are very informative and are sufficient for the topic.

He is absolutely great Prof and has outstanding teaching skills. His video lectures and notes covers every topic with a great information that each and every doubt of yours will be explained in there. He is passionate about the quality of education to be delivered to students. The more you interact with him, the more you learn from him. Awesome!!
He is the best teacher, I've met for computer programming.

Great prof!! Super friendly and approachable, he may make fun of you just a little bit (attending office hour last minute :p) and your silly problems but it's all in good faith! His slides are very informative but make sure to watch his videos since it covers a lot more than what he has in the slides. Highly recommended prof!

Great and easy to understand slide. The class I had was online, yet I had no problem following and learning the course material solely with slides(didn't watch his recorded lecture as recording was poor). However, we got 0 grades for the weekly quizzes until week 11(out of total 13 weeks). He is literally the opposite end of "timely feedback."
really dedicated teacher
He will clear all your doubts. Amazing prof
Friendly
Amazing
Participation Matters. Skip Class? You won't pass. Amazing Lecture.

Meh, dry lecturer. If you watch lecture recordings + do practice Q's on his obsidian, you'll be fine. Assignments, midterms, and quizzes were fair, but final was a bit hard. Make sure to know ur MC, as half (or maybe more) of our final was MC.

Lectures always feel productive albeit a bit dry + they're recorded. His notes are great for studying. Assignment criteria is clear and they're graded fairly imo. No surprises during exams if you listen to lectures, do the weekly quizzes and hw. Lots of multiple choice; make sure you have a good understanding of underlying concepts/terms.
Boring explanations, unfair horrible multiple choice questions on quizes and exams, very mid.

Comprehensive notes, recorded lectures, practical teaching. Average workload with 5 assignments throughout the term, weekly quizzes, 1 midterm and 1 final exam. Some issues with grading assignments but I had a positive experience overall.

Where do I begin? Completely disorganized lectures, awkward when answering questions, and marking seems to be utter madness at best. Just to give you an idea of how insane the grading scheme was, participation was worth more than the final exam. Also, if you so much as get the capitalization wrong for your function name, the whole thing is wrong.

I'm not sure about his teaching in person, but online was an absolute bore. Assignment requirements are hardly clear and frequently misses things that should be on there, which makes you lose a few unnecessary marks. Despite that, super easy course if you pay attention and double-check everything.
Great Proff

He is one of the nicest instructors I've had thus far, his lectures are great and he gives extra effort to explain things again with good examples if you don't understand something. He even gives out snacks from time to time and he goes the extra mile to teach extra stuff if you are interested. Pay attention to his lectures and you should do well.

He's a really kind instructor that really helps student to learn about the course. Really approachable and welcome any kind of questions. He also give fair marks. I would totally recommend taking the course with him
Amazing lecturer, has superb patience on explaining much abstract concept. Pay attention in classroom and you do just fine.
Pay attention in class and you would easily get an A. Very caring and supportive. Lengthy lectures but covering all material.
But honestly, shes very pretty=
dont take

She doesn't explain the theory behind each code she just goes through roughly, but I am a fxxking rookie!! and this makes my learning very difficult. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!  It is a waste of money, sleep, brain and time.  Finally, if you ask her a question, it is better a small issue. otherwise she will mock you with her eyes.
I contacted her about reviewing my final exam and grades, and she changed my grade up from c- to c+ after finding her own mistake. I think she give grade fairly.
She is the best prof. that I ever took in my life. I really want to take more classes with her.

I can say that i have never given a prof a bad score. I am in SFU and we are going through OOP again. The only thing i will say to you is that she is an incompetent teacher and person. Do not take her class if possible, if you do, do not confuse yourself with her classes just read the book and online sources so that you can learn.
She is very knowledgeable but she doesn't have a grading criteria and sucks at teaching. If you can avoid, don't take her class.

She's a great teacher. I appreciate her teaching on indenting and coding habits. They help you produce better quality codes. And guys, you need to read the book more and do more practice if you hope to get good in coding. No one can hold your hands and guide you step by step in university. You'll realize it the more programming courses you take.
she always said" you should read!!!" but never tell you what the problem of your code, and also yeil that" your codes are very wrong."
She is knowledgeable but she yells at students when ask questions. Not patient at all. Expects you to get everything in the first time and does not answer any questions. Im afraid of her.

One of the best. SFU is lucky to have him. Clear assignments. Quizzes based on slides. Go to class & you get hints. Pay attention & ace the quizzes. Scott is funny. Great personality. Ask him questions, he loves to help. 10/10 prof. Would take a class with him again, 100%.

Best so far. He's 100% into lectures and goes on a tangent to explain any question you ask . Funny, high energy, and practically begs you to come to his office hours. This guy is a machine. You can email him 24/7 for a reply within 5 minutes, and he creates entire program frameworks overnight from scratch for simple assignments. Huge Industry exp.

Awesome professor. He was very enthusiastic during lecturers, you can tell he has a passion for what he does. He is great at helping his students and is willing to take time out of his busy schedule to meet with his students. 10/10 would recommend.

Scott is the man! His lectures are informative and his tests are super clear. The assignments can get a little tough but he's always there for you if you need help. Office hours are also really great, and he's really fast on emails. He's really passionate about CS and was nice enough to move my exam to another day since I had a conflict )
